See the biggest moments from the opening ceremony of the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.

TV REVIEW: Even if Milan's ceremony didn't match the Paris one in scale, it made for an equally enthusiastic welcome to the world's largest sporting event.

Fresh of the back of taking Sundance by storm with “The Moment,” Charli xcx appears to be gearing up with another hot film project.

 Variety has learned that her…

Shinedown have become the fourth artist to pull out of Kid Rock’s MAGA-leaning “Rock the Country” music festival, the band announced on social media Friday.

 The…

As the industry begins its latest round of union contract talks on Monday, Hollywood is fighting wars on many fronts.

 The health plans that cover most of the…

Storm Reid is on board to star in and produce the Paramount movie.

The two discuss 'Wicked: For Good,' what makes them cry and loving 'The Waterboy.'

The two on their life-changing 'Mummy' friendship, loneliness and learning to stop trying so hard.

A Variety and iHeartRadio Podcast

Rachel McAdams thrives on a desert island in Sam Raimi's twisted survival thriller. Going back to his roots, Raimi wickedly flips the dynamic between a number cruncher and her nightmare boss.

In a mockumentary that plays it straight, Charli xcx is teamed with a doofus director (Alexander Skarsgård) who wants to clean up her image. But why would any version of Charli xcx say yes?

Brett Ratner's First Lady documentary is a cheeseball infomercial of staggering inertia. There's no drama to a film that should have been called "Day of the Living Tradwife."

The first feature by the YouTube gamer personality Markiplier is a murky sci-fi horror tale that confines us to a midget submarine. The claustrophobic perils are plentiful but wear thin.

'Interior Chinatown' Struggles to Turn an Allegorical Novel Into a Show

HBO Prequel Series 'Dune: Prophecy' Capably Tailors the Epic Franchise to Television

Taylor Sheridan's 'Landman' Gives the West Texas Oil Fields the 'Yellowstone' Treatment

Eddie Redmayne and Lashana Lynch's 'The Day of the Jackal' Is an Exhilarating Assassin Thriller

Billie Eilish and producer Finneas keep up their winning streak with a surprising and intimate third album.

Childish Gambino's latest is a masterpiece, and a kaleidoscopic showcase for his seemingly endless talents.

Vince Staples searches for light on his new album, his most vulnerable project to date.

Dua Lipa's new album is a joyous blast of pop savvy.

Sam Gold's production is an actorly face-off between Jeremy Strong and Michael Imperioli, but the script ultimately let's the audience off the hook.

Patricia Clarkson gives a luminous performance in an otherwise uneven revival of Eugene O'Neill's family drama.

The stage adaptation has escapism, enchantment and heart, all elevated to new, literal heights that blend theater and cirque.

Popular on Variety

 
 
 

 

 
 
 ‘Joybubbles’ Director Rachael Morrison and Editors Bradford Thomason and Patrick Lawrence on Their Retro Phone Hacker Doc
 
 
 

 
 
 Perfection is rarely achieved in movies, but this heaven-sent concert doc hits the sweet spot. Over two days in January 1972, the Queen of Soul, Aretha Franklin — she was 29 at the time — sweeps into the New Temple Missionary Baptist Church in Watts in front of a congregation and testifies to God in song. The blessed thing took nearly half a century to come out because director Sydney Pollack failed to sync the image with the sound. Then digital angels stepped in, and glory, glory, hallelujah!

dtliExcerpt: Kevin Kline brings his customary intelligence and theatrical flair to the title role, but the production feels overly respectful and lacks the passion that should drive this romantic drama.
showScoreExcerpt: Kevin Kline brings his customary intelligence and theatrical flair to the title role, but the production feels overly respectful and lacks the passion that should drive this romantic drama.

keyPhrases.quote: Kevin Kline brings his customary intelligence and theatrical flair to the title role, but the production feels overly respectful and lacks the passion that should drive this romantic drama.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-unanimous] | All 4 models agree: Mixed | Claude: Praises Kline's performance but criticizes the production as lacking passion and being overly respectful. Single excerpt warning applies - this balanced critique suggests mixed reception. | GPT-4o: The review praises Kevin Kline's performance but criticizes the production for lacking passion, suggesting a mixed impression. With only one excerpt, the confidence is low. | Gemini: The review praises Kline's performance but criticizes the production for lacking passion. This suggests a mixed assessment, leaning slightly positive due to the praise for Kline. | Kimi: Single excerpt praises the lead actor's performance but criticizes the production as lacking passion and being overly respectful, suggesting a split verdict where the star shines but the show itself disappoints.

contentMismatchNote: Wrong content detected by audit - fullText is about different show
rejectionReasoning: claude: This appears to be a website navigation menu, article feed, or aggregated content snippets rather than a coherent theater review. The text jumps between unrelated topics including TV shows, movies, music albums, and repeats the same content multiple times.; openai: The text provided is a collection of unrelated snippets and headlines, not a coherent review of a Broadway show.; gemini: This is a collection of unrelated news headlines and snippets, not a review of a specific show.; kimi: This text is a corrupted mix of webpage navigation elements, article headlines, and multiple unrelated review excerpts (covering TV, film, and theater) rather than a single coherent Broadway review. The content includes repeated 'Popular on Variety' template sections, news headlines about Donald Trump and Netflix, and snippets of multiple different theater reviews without a clear target show. The aggregator context mentions Kevin Kline, who does not appear in the provided text, confirming a mismatch.
